title: Average annual consumer spending , by type U.S. 2018
summary: This is a bar chart representing Spending Type in the x axis and Spending in U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The Spending in U.S. dollars is highest at Spending Type Housing and lowest at Spending Type Apparel and services.
The difference of Spending in U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest Spending Type is 18225.0.
min_summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing Spending Type, and Spending in U.S. dollars in each Spending Type on the y axis.
Spending Type Housing has the highest Spending in U.S. dollars and Apparel and services has the lowest Spending in U.S. dollars.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Spending Type in the x axis and Spending in U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The Spending in U.S. dollars is highest at Spending Type Housing and lowest at Spending Type Apparel and services.
The difference of Spending in U.S. dollars between the highest and lowest Spending Type is 18225.0.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Spending Type in the x axis and Spending in U.S. dollars in the y axis.
The maximum Spending in U.S. dollars 20091.0 is found at Spending Type Housing and the minimum is found at Apparel and services where Spending Type is 1866.0.
The second highest Spending in U.S. dollars is appeared to be the Spending Type Transportation.
The lowest value at Spending Type Apparel and services is 10.77x times less than the highest value at Housing.
Spending in U.S. dollars at Spending Type Housing is 20091.0 , second place is Transportation at 9761.0, and thirdly is Food at 7923.0.
The average Spending in U.S. dollars in all 9 Spending Types is 6561.0.
The Spending in U.S. dollars is 59049.0 if we add up values of all Spending Types.
